definition: to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: Our security is assured by our perseverance and by our sure belief in the success of liberty.
sentences.chinese: 對自由的堅信不移和堅忍不拔是我們安全的保證。

sentences.english: Only by hard study and much patience can one master a foreign language.
sentences.chinese: 只有靠努力學習和堅忍不拔的意志才能掌握外語。

sentences.english: Stick with it Douglas. Your fortitude is an example to us all.
sentences.chinese: 道格拉斯堅持下去，你的堅忍不拔是我們大家的榜樣。

sentences.english: Do you want to be courageous, disciplined, creative, and persistent or not?
sentences.chinese: 你是否希望自己勇敢，自制，敢於創新並且堅忍不拔？

sentences.english: Perseverance is a quality that behoves in a scientist.
sentences.chinese: 堅忍不拔是科學家應當具備的品質。

sentences.english: Google is pretty relentless, so that's very interesting.
sentences.chinese: 谷歌確實堅忍不拔，所以這很有意思。

sentences.english: We should stick to and develop the heritage of persistency.
sentences.chinese: 我們應堅持和發揚堅忍不拔的傳統。

definition: firm and indomitable (idiom); tenacious and unyielding
to keep on fighting in spite of all setbacks (idiom)/to be undaunted by repeated setbacks/to be indomitable
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to bear hardships and work hard (idiom); assiduous and long-suffering/hard-working and capable of overcoming adversity
see 念念不忘[nian4 nian4 bu4 wang4]
to follow through/to carry through to the end
lit. to cut one's way through thistles and thorns (idiom)/fig. to overcome all obstacles on the way/to break through hardships/to blaze a new trail
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
